metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33235 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow vulnerability in write_node in htmldoc through 1.9.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service via htmldoc/htmldoc/html.cxx:588.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

htmldoc - 1.9.15-1
htmldoc-common - 1.9.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: htmldoc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.15-1').
